Stuff To Do

Some of our favorite places to eat, drink and hangout. If you're going to be in town for a few days, check out a few of them.

Brooklyn

  • Tacos el Bronco - Best tacos in Brooklyn
  • Jpan - Great sushi
  • Naruto - Ramen
  • Tanoreen - Delicious Middle Eastern food.
  • Brooklyn Bridge - A Bridge... partly In Brooklyn.
  • Industry City Distillery - Local Vodka Distillery whose tasting room has killer views.
  • The Levee - Basically a trash bar, but hosted a lot of Team Chrait history.
  • Prospect Park - Brooklyn's Central Park.

Manhattan

  • ABC Kitchen - Local and seasonal restaurant near Union Square.
  • Vanessa's Dumplings - Delicious, cheap dumplings.
  • AMNH - American Museum of Natural History. They've got dinoaurs and a plane'arium.
  • Statue of Liberty
  • Top of the Rock - Viewing deck for 30 Rockafeller Center has great views of the city and the park.
  • High Line - An old elevated train line that is now a park on the westside.
  • Tenement Museum - Museum in an old apartment building that housed thousands of immigrants in the 19th-20th century.
  • Finn's (Bay Area sports bar) - They don't show Raiders games, but whatever.

Get a Sweat Going

  • KORE New York - HIIT Studio that will destroy you.
  • Swerve - Competitive cycling studio.
  • Peloton - Bougie cycling studio with "really nice bikes" per Caitlin.
